passages.name: C1S1 Hub
passages.text:
@@.loc;Hub@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Hub Clean")>>\s
	A few discarded sweaters, snack wrappers, and glasses lie scattered around the casual lounge that makes up the house's hub. The tops of some of the bookcases are showing signs of dust. [[Clean the house hub.|C1S1 Hub Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The casual lounge that makes up the house's hub is neat and cosy.
<</if>>\s

A heavily reinforced door leads to the [[garden|C1S1 Garden]], internal doors lead to the [[garage|C1S1 Garage]] and [[dining room|C1S1 Dining Room]], and a staircase leads up to the [[upper level|C1S1 Upstairs]].

Your [[charging station|C1S1 Hub Charging Station]] stands in the corner.

passages.name: C1S1 Hub Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
You methodically discard the snack wrappers, load the clothes into the hidden auto-laundry, and arrange the cushions neatly on the seats. Your duster attachment makes short work of the dusty furniture. Soon the hub sparkles like a house showroom.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Hub]]


/% ==================== GARDEN ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S1 Garden
passages.text:
@@.loc;Garden@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Garden Clean")>>\s
	The driveway curves through an expanse of manicured lawn, on which lie the balls, hoops, and mallets of a discarded croquet game. Empty cocktail glasses sit on a table next to the sun loungers, and the swimming pool is covered with a layer of floating leaves. [[Tidy the garden.|C1S1 Garden Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The driveway curves through an expanse of manicured lawn, and a pair of sun loungers overlook a sparkling swimming pool.
<</if>>\s

<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Garden Lawnmower Activate")>>\s
	The lawn is just starting to get overgrown. [[Activate the gardening robot.|C1S1 Garden Lawnmower Activate]]
<<else>>\s
	The sheep-like gardening robot mindlessly works its way back and forth across the lawn.
<</if>>\s

The driveway runs from the [[garage door|C1S1 Garage]] to the [[security gate|C1S1 Street]], and a path leads to the [[front door|C1S1 Hub]].

passages.name: C1S1 Garden Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
You tidy the croquet set into its rustic wooden box, take the cocktail glasses into the kitchen, and fetch the pool net to sweep the leaves from the pool.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Garden]]

passages.name: C1S1 Garden Lawnmower Activate
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
The gardening robot responds to your command with an enthusiastic beep, and emerges from its kennel to begin grazing.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Garden]]


/% ==================== STREET ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S1 Street
passages.text:
@@.loc;Street@@
<<if previous() == "C1S1 Garden">>\s
	The security gate recognises you and opens just wide enough to let you through. \s
<</if>>\s
The wide, tree-lined street is empty, which is unusual for this time of day; normally there would be joggers or cyclists enjoying the sunshine. The other houses are hidden behind their own privacy walls.\s
<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Street Graffiti Clean")>>\s
	There is unsightly [[graffiti|C1S1 Street Graffiti]] scrawled on the wall around your masters' garden.\s
<</if>>

The [[security gate|C1S1 Garden]] remains ready to re-admit you.

passages.name: C1S1 Street Graffiti
passages.text:
@@.graffiti;FUCK YOU RICH ASSHOLES!@@
@@.graffiti;THE CURE DOESN'T WORK!@@

[[Clean up the graffiti.|C1S1 Street Graffiti Clean]]

passages.name: C1S1 Street Graffiti Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
The graffiti gradually dissolves under your heavy-duty cleaning attachment. After a few minutes the wall is spotless again.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Street]]


/% ==================== GARAGE ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S1 Garage
passages.text:
@@.loc;Garage@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Garage Clean")>>\s
	An expanse of dust and dirt covers the concrete floor where Master Xander and Mistress Yvonne's towncars park when they are home. The vintage motorcycle that Mistress Yvonne has been restoring stands in one corner surrounded by tools, its dust cover lying beside it. [[Clean the garage.|C1S1 Garage Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The concrete floor is spotless, waiting for Master Xander's and Mistress Yvonne's towncars to return. Mistress Yvonne's vintage motorcycle stands beneath its dust cover, next to a neatly-packed box of tools.
<</if>>\s

The main garage door leads to the [[garden|C1S1 Garden]], and a set of steps lead up to the house's [[hub|C1S1 Hub]].

passages.name: C1S1 Garage Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
You methodically sweep the floor, concentrating the dirt into a corner and then sweeping it out into the garden. Careful not to disturb Mistress Yvonne's work, you pack away her tools and put the dust cover back over her motorcycle.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Garage]]


/% ==================== DINING ROOM ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S1 Dining Room
passages.text:
@@.loc;Dining Room@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Dining Room Clean")>>\s
	The dining room is more formal than the house hub, with a mahogany table decorated with silver candlesticks. The dark wood shows dust easily, so some of the cabinets are already visibly dusty. The remains of the Masters' breakfast sit on the table. [[Clean the dining room.|C1S1 Dining Room Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The dining room is more formal than the house hub, with a mahogany table decorated with silver candlesticks. The dark wood is spotless.
<</if>>\s

<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Dining Room Cook")>>\s
	The automated kitchen is built into one wall. [[Instruct it to start making dinner.|C1S1 Dining Room Cook]]
<<else>>\s
	A busy sound issues from the kitchen as it assembles ingredients and prepares to make \s
	<<if $c1s1_meal == 1>>\s
		steak au poivre.
	<<elseif $c1s1_meal == 2>>\s
		chicken piccata.
	<<else>>\s
		tofu panang curry.
	<</if>>\s
<</if>>\s

A door leads back to the [[hub|C1S1 Hub]].

links.text: Instruct it to start making dinner.

passages.name: C1S1 Dining Room Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
You load the breakfast plates into the kitchen's dishwasher, then wipe the table, dust the room's surfaces, and polish the silver until it shines.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Dining Room]]

passages.name: C1S1 Dining Room Cook
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
The Masters will expect dinner to be ready when they return home this evening.

[[Instruct the kitchen to prepare steak au poivre (Master Xander's favourite).|C1S1 Dining Room Cook Something][$c1s1_meal = 1]]

[[Instruct the kitchen to prepare chicken piccata (Mistress Yvonne's favourite).|C1S1 Dining Room Cook Something][$c1s1_meal = 2]]

[[Instruct the kitchen to prepare tofu panang curry (Mistress Zoe's favourite).|C1S1 Dining Room Cook Something][$c1s1_meal = 3]]

links.text: Instruct the kitchen to prepare steak au poivre (Master Xander's favourite).
Instruct the kitchen to prepare chicken piccata (Mistress Yvonne's favourite).
Instruct the kitchen to prepare tofu panang curry (Mistress Zoe's favourite).

passages.name: C1S1 Dining Room Cook Something
passages.text:
The kitchen accepts your command, and you hear a clunk from inside its mechanism as it opens its internal stores to retrieve in the ingredients.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Dining Room]]


/% ==================== UPSTAIRS ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S1 Upstairs
passages.text:
@@.loc;Upstairs Landing@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Upstairs Clean")>>\s
	The framed family photographs on the walls of the landing are disfigured by pen marks. [[Clean the photographs.|C1S1 Upstairs Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	Framed photographs of the family's wealthy ancestors look out on the landing.
<</if>>\s

Doors lead to the [[master bedroom|C1S1 Master Bedroom]], [[Mistress Zoe's room|C1S1 Zoe Bedroom]], and [[Master Xander's home office|C1S1 Office]]. The main staircase leads back down to the [[hub|C1S1 Hub]], and a smaller staircase leads to the [[roof|C1S1 Roof]].

passages.name: C1S1 Upstairs Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
Someone (likely Mistress Zoe) has drawn monocles, moustaches, and devil horns on the glass covering the photographs of the family's ancestors. You painstakingly wipe it off, revealing the faces of the CEOs and entrepreneurs on Mistress Yvonne's side of the family and the real estate barons on Master Xander's side.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Upstairs]]


/% ==================== MASTER BEDROOM ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S1 Master Bedroom
passages.text:
@@.loc;Master Bedroom@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Master Bedroom Clean")>>\s
	Sheets are piled on the floor next to Master Xander and Mistress Yvonne's bed, a towel hangs on the exercise machine, and some of the cosmetics bottles on Mistress Yvonne's vanity table are empty. In the en suite bathroom, water trickles from the sink's tap. [[Clean the bedroom.|C1S1 Master Bedroom Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	Master Xander and Mistress Yvonne's bed is neatly made with crisp white sheets, the exercise machine stands gleaming in the corner, and full cosmetic bottles stand in a neat row on Mistress Yvonne's vanity table. \s
	<<if hasVisited("C1S1 Master Bedroom Underwear Leave")>>\s
		The strange woman's underwear lies neatly folded on the bed. \s
	<</if>>\s
	The en suite bathroom sparkles.
<</if>>\s

A door leads back to the [[upstairs landing|C1S1 Upstairs]].

passages.name: C1S1 Master Bedroom Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
You tidy up the towels, clean the bathroom, turn off the tap, and refill the cosmetic bottles on the vanity table.

While changing the bed sheets, you notice something under the bed. It is a pair of women's underwear, but not one belongin to Mistress Yvonne, and not in her size.

[[Hide the underwear.|C1S1 Master Bedroom Underwear Discard]]

[[Leave it where Mistress Yvonne will find it.|C1S1 Master Bedroom Underwear Leave]]

links.text: Leave it where Mistress Yvonne will find it.

passages.name: C1S1 Master Bedroom Underwear Discard
passages.text: You hide the incriminating underwear in the rest of the laundry, and make a note to dispose of it or return it to its rightful owner later.\n\n[[Continue.|C1S1 Master Bedroom]]

passages.name: C1S1 Master Bedroom Underwear Leave
passages.text:
You neatly fold the unknown woman's underwear and put it on the bed.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Master Bedroom]]


/% ==================== ZOE'S BEDROOM ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S1 Zoe Bedroom
passages.text:
@@.loc;Zoe's Bedroom@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Zoe Bedroom Clean")>>\s
	Mistress Zoe's bedroom is a chaos of clothes, bedding, books, and soft drink cans. The en suite bathroom looks like a bottle of hair dye has exploded in the bath. [[Tidy it up.|C1S1 Zoe Bedroom Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	Mistress Zoe's bed is made, her bathroom gleams, and her books sit neatly on their shelves.
<</if>>\s

A door leads back to the [[upstairs landing|C1S1 Upstairs]].

passages.name: C1S1 Zoe Bedroom Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
You spend time tidying, dusting, scrubbing, and changing bedsheets until the room is unrecognisable.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Zoe Bedroom]]




/% ==================== OFFICE ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S1 Office
passages.text:
@@.loc;Master Xander's Office@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Office Clean")>>\s
	A complicated ergonomic chair stands to one side of a desk with a wrap-around 3D monitor and an empty coffee cup. The walls are covered in robot design schematics, framed business school diplomas and management awards, and a photograph of Master Xander's luxury yacht. [[Tidy the office.|C1S1 Office Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	A complicated ergonomic chair sits neatly under a desk with a wrap-around 3D monitor. The walls are covered in robot design schematics, framed business school diplomas and management awards, and a photograph of Master Xander's luxury yacht.
<</if>>\s

A door leads back to the [[upstairs landing|C1S1 Upstairs]].

passages.name: C1S1 Office Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
You dust the furniture, push the chair under the desk, and take the coffee cup down to the kitchen.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Office]]


/% ==================== ROOF ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S1 Roof
passages.text:
@@.loc;Roof@@
From the roof patio you can see a vista of brown-grey mountains in one direction and the sparkling ocean in the other. The sea wall that protects the low-lying areas of the city from the rising sea level shines white in the sunlight. You can see what you think are columns of smoke rising from the city, but your eyes are not designed to focus at long range so you cannot be sure.

<<if !hasVisited("C1S1 Roof Clean")>>\s
	Leaves and twigs are strewn across the rooftop patio, and one of the chairs lies on its side where the most recent storm blew it over. The solar panels that supply the house (and yourself) with power have a little wind-blown dirt stuck in their corners. [[Clean the roof.|C1S1 Roof Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The rooftop patio is neatly swept, and the table and chairs are positioned to admire the view. The solar panels are clean and working perfectly.
<</if>>\s

A door leads to the staircase [[back into the house|C1S1 Upstairs]].

passages.name: C1S1 Roof Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 2>>\s
You sweep the debris off the side of the roof, rearrange the chairs and table, and brush the dust from the solar panel.

[[Continue.|C1S1 Roof]]


/% ==================== HUB CHARGING STATION (END OF SCENE) ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S1 Hub Charging Station
passages.text:
The charging station opens to accept you into its deactivating embrace.

<<if hasVisited("C1S1 Hub Clean", "C1S1 Garden Clean", "C1S1 Garden Lawnmower Activate", "C1S1 Street Graffiti Clean", "C1S1 Garage Clean", "C1S1 Dining Room Clean", "C1S1 Dining Room Cook", "C1S1 Upstairs Clean", "C1S1 Master Bedroom Clean", "C1S1 Zoe Bedroom Clean", "C1S1 Office Clean", "C1S1 Roof Clean")>>\s
	You have done everything you can to maintain the house for now.
	
	[[Enter the charging station and hibernate.|C1S1 Hub Charging Station Enter]]
<<else>>\s
	You have not yet done everything you can to maintain the house for your Masters.
	
	[[Step away from the charging station.|C1S1 Hub]]
<</if>>\s

links.text: Enter the charging station and hibernate.
Step away from the charging station.

passages.name: C1S1 Hub Charging Station Enter
passages.text: The charging station's arms fold around you, its power supply begins to recharge you, and you feel your consciousness wind down. You are sure your masters will be pleased at the way you have served them.\n\n[[They will return soon.|C1S2 Hub]]

passages.name: C1S2 Hub
passages.text:
@@.loc;Hub@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S2 Hub Clean")>>\s
	Several windows are smashed, and the floor and all the furniture are covered in yellow-brown dust. The armchairs are sagging and eaten away, spilling yellowing foam, and books and ornaments lie scattered on the floor as if they fell in an earthquake. [[Clean the house hub.|C1S2 Hub Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The hub is clear of dust, but the faded furniture and wallpaper still makes it seem greyish yellow. The armchairs are misshapen and show scars where you mended them. Several of the windows are empty of glass.
<</if>>\s

A heavily reinforced door leads to the [[garden|C1S2 Garden]], internal doors lead to the [[garage|C1S2 Garage]] and [[dining room|C1S2 Dining Room]], and a staircase leads up to the [[upper level|C1S2 Upstairs]].

Your [[charging station|C1S2 Hub Charging Station]] stands in the corner.

passages.name: C1S2 Hub Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You spend hours sweeping the room clean of dust picking up the scattered objects, and disposing of the broken glass beneath the windows. You lack the equipment to repair the windows, but you remove the fragments of glass from their edges so that the Masters will not cut themselves when they return. You mend the tears in the furniture, although they are still stained and misshapen. The hub is not perfect, but it is as presentable as you can make it.

[[Continue.|C1S2 Hub]]


/% ==================== GARDEN ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S2 Garden
passages.text:
@@.loc;Garden@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S2 Garden Clean")>>\s
	The garden has become an expanse of sand and dirt, with a few clumps of tall, scrubby grass. Sand covers the bottom of the empty swimming pool. The gardening robot lies half-buried. [[Tidy the garden.|C1S2 Garden Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The garden is an expanse of swept sand, with a clean, empty swimming pool. The gardening robot sits inactive in its charging kennel.
<</if>>\s

The driveway runs from the [[garage door|C1S2 Garage]] to the [[security gate|C1S2 Street]], and a path leads to the [[front door|C1S2 Hub]].

passages.name: C1S2 Garden Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You cannot restore the Masters' lawn or refill their swimming pool, but you pull up the weeds and shovel the sand from the bottom of the pool. The gardening robot is inactive and does not respond to your commands, so you put it back in its charging kennel.

[[Continue.|C1S2 Garden]]



/% ==================== STREET ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S2 Street
passages.text:
@@.loc;Street@@
<<if visited() == 1>>\s
	The security gate does not automatically open for you, forcing you to push it open. \s
<</if>>\s
You Masters' security wall is intact, but many of the other compounds are cracked or crumbling. The trees lining the street are overgrown, and unkempt plants grow through cracks in the road surface.

The [[security gate|C1S2 Garden]] is stuck open.




/% ==================== GARAGE ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S2 Garage
passages.text:
@@.loc;Garage@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S2 Garage Clean")>>\s
	The garage floor is covered by a thin layer of drifting sand. Mistress Yvonne's motorcycle is lying on its side, broken. [[Clean the garage.|C1S2 Garage Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The garage is bare and empty. Mistress Yvonne's motorcycle stands under its dust sheet.
<</if>>\s

The main garage door leads to the [[garden|C1S2 Garden]], and a set of steps lead up to the house's [[hub|C1S2 Hub]].

passages.name: C1S2 Garage Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You pick up the motorcycle and put it back under its dust cover. The damage it took in the fall has set Mistress Yvonne's repair work back, but perhaps she will enjoy restoring it again. You sweep the expanse of garage floor.

[[Continue.|C1S2 Garage]]


/% ==================== DINING ROOM ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S2 Dining Room
passages.text:
@@.loc;Dining Room@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S2 Dining Room Clean")>>\s
	The dining room is less dusty than the house hub, but the silver candlesticks lie scattered at the foot of the table and the carpet is moth-eaten. Spider-webs hang from the dark corners of the ceiling. [[Clean the dining room.|C1S2 Dining Room Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The carpet is somewhat moth-eaten, but the mahogany table and silver candlesticks are spotless.
<</if>>\s

<<if !hasVisited("C1S2 Dining Room Kitchen")>>\s
	The auto-kitchen stands dark and inactive, but flies buzz around it. [[Examine the kitchen.|C1S2 Dining Room Kitchen]]
<<else>>\s
	The auto-kitchen stands dark and inactive.
<</if>>\s

A door leads back to the [[hub|C1S2 Hub]].

passages.name: C1S2 Dining Room Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You vacuum away the spider webs, dust every surface, and restore the candlesticks to their proper places.

[[Continue.|C1S2 Dining Room]]

passages.name: C1S2 Dining Room Kitchen
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
Mould is growing on the shrivelled remains of the \s
<<if $c1s1_meal == 1>>\s
	steak au poivre \s
<<elseif $c1s1_meal == 2>>\s
	chicken piccata \s
<<else>>\s
	tofu panang curry \s
<</if>>\s
you made for your Masters. You assume they decided to go out for dinner rather than eat at home. You dispose of the spoiled food.

[[Continue.|C1S2 Dining Room]]



/% ==================== UPSTAIRS ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S2 Upstairs
passages.text:
@@.loc;Upstairs Landing@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S2 Upstairs Clean")>>\s
	The upstairs landing has less of the dust that the hub did, but the carpet appears to have been eaten away by insects. Several of the family photographs have fallen off the walls. [[Pick them up.|C1S2 Upstairs Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	Faded, framed photographs of the family's wealthy ancestors look out on the landing's moth-eaten carpet, some of them from behind cracked glass.
<</if>>\s

Doors lead to the [[master bedroom|C1S2 Master Bedroom]], [[Mistress Zoe's room|C1S2 Zoe Bedroom]], and [[Master Xander's home office|C1S2 Office]]. The main staircase leads back down to the [[hub|C1S2 Hub]], and a smaller staircase leads to the [[roof|C1S2 Roof]].

passages.name: C1S2 Upstairs Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You pick up the portraits and dust them off one by one. The photographs have faded, and some of them have cracked glass. You restore them to their places on the walls.

[[Continue.|C1S2 Upstairs]]


/% ==================== MASTER BEDROOM ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S2 Master Bedroom
passages.text:
@@.loc;Master Bedroom@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S2 Master Bedroom Clean")>>\s
	A sound of squawking and flapping assaults you as soon as you enter the room. The window is smashed, and Master Xander and Mistress Yvonne's bedroom has become home to a colony of pigeons. The bedsheets have been torn into nest material, and what is left of the carpet is covered in guano. [[Chase off the birds and tidy the room.|C1S2 Master Bedroom Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The bedroom still is dilapidated and smells of birds, but it is as good as you can make it.
<</if>>\s

A door leads back to the [[upstairs landing|C1S2 Upstairs]].

links.text: Chase off the birds and tidy the room.

passages.name: C1S2 Master Bedroom Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You are not designed for animal control, but you flail at the pigeons until they all fly out of the window, leaving you with a few scratches and spots of guano. When they are gone, you clear the broken glass from the edges of the window, and clean the birds' debris from the room. You discard of the wrecked bedsheets and replace them with mostly-intact sheets from a cupboard.

[[Continue.|C1S2 Master Bedroom]]


/% ==================== ZOE'S BEDROOM ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S2 Zoe Bedroom
passages.text:
@@.loc;Zoe's Bedroom@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S2 Zoe Bedroom Clean")>>\s
	Mistress Zoe's bookshelves have collapsed, and her paperback books lie rotting on the floor. [[Tidy up.|C1S2 Zoe Bedroom Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	What remains of Mistress Zoe's furniture and possessions are in their proper places, but a feeling of decay still hangs in the room.
<</if>>\s

A door leads back to the [[upstairs landing|C1S2 Upstairs]].

passages.name: C1S2 Zoe Bedroom Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You reassemble the bookcases as best you can, and arrange the decaying books in the order Mistress Zoe likes them.

[[Continue.|C1S2 Zoe Bedroom]]




/% ==================== OFFICE ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S2 Office
passages.text:
@@.loc;Master Xander's Office@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S2 Office Clean")>>\s
	The office is damp, and dominated by a huge water stain on the floor and the ceiling above it, directly below the water tank on the roof. Master Xander's desk is decaying from water damage, and his wraparound 3D display lies cracked on its side. [[Tidy the office.|C1S2 Office Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	Master Xander's chair sits under a damaged desk with a cracked 3D monitor. The water stains on the floor and ceiling are faded but still noticeable.
<</if>>\s

A door leads back to the [[upstairs landing|C1S2 Upstairs]].

passages.name: C1S2 Office Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You are not equipped to repair the structural water damage, but you do your best to clean the stain from the carpet, and restore Master Xander's display to its upright position.

[[Continue.|C1S2 Office]]


/% ==================== ROOF ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S2 Roof
passages.text:
@@.loc;Roof@@
From the roof patio you can see that the ocean comes closer to the house than the last time you awoke: the sea wall has ruptured, flooding low-lying areas of the city. The parts of the city that are above water appear burned, and many of the tall buildings have collapsed into rubble.

<<if !hasVisited("C1S2 Roof Clean")>>\s
	The roof patio is covered in dirt and dead leaves. The fence around the edge of the roof is smashed, and the patio furniture is gone, perhaps blown away in a storm. The house's water tank is partly rusted away and empty. The solar panels that supply the house's power are mostly covered in sand. [[Clean the roof.|C1S2 Roof Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The rusted water tank and gleaming solar panels stand on a clean, bare roof.
<</if>>\s

A door leads to the staircase [[back into the house|C1S2 Upstairs]].

passages.name: C1S2 Roof Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
There is nothing you can do about the missing furniture, but you sweep the roof clear of dirt, and clean the solar panels to restore power to your charging station and the house's other systems.

[[Continue.|C1S2 Roof]]


/% ==================== HUB CHARGING STATION (END OF SCENE) ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S2 Hub Charging Station
passages.text:
The charging station opens to accept you into its deactivating embrace.

<<if hasVisited("C1S2 Hub Clean", "C1S2 Garden Clean", "C1S2 Garage Clean", "C1S2 Dining Room Clean", "C1S2 Dining Room Kitchen", "C1S2 Upstairs Clean", "C1S2 Master Bedroom Clean", "C1S2 Zoe Bedroom Clean", "C1S2 Office Clean", "C1S2 Roof Clean")>>\s
	You have done everything you can to maintain the house for now.
	
	[[Enter the charging station and hibernate.|C1S2 Hub Charging Station Enter]]
<<else>>\s
	You have not yet done everything you can to maintain the house for your Masters.
	
	[[Step away from the charging station.|C1S2 Hub]]
<</if>>\s

links.text: Enter the charging station and hibernate.
Step away from the charging station.

passages.name: C1S2 Hub Charging Station Enter
passages.text:
The charging station's arms fold around you, its power supply begins to recharge you, and you feel your consciousness wind down. After what you saw, you begin to doubt that the Masters will return.

[[Surely they will return eventually.|C1S3 Hub]]

passages.name: C1S3 Hub
passages.text:
@@.loc;Hub@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S3 Hub Clean")>>\s
	A thick layer of dirt covers the sagging husks of the Masters' furniture. Dust drifts in from the glassless windows, and cracks stretch across the walls. The bones of a dead animal lie in one corner. [[Clean the house hub.|C1S3 Hub Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The sagging husks of the Masters' furniture stand in the bare room. The windows are glassless holes, and cracks stretch across the walls.
<</if>>\s

The door to the [[garden|C1S3 Garden]] has fallen out of its frame. The doors to the [[garage|C1S3 Rubble]] and [[dining room|C1S3 Rubble]] are partially blocked with rubble. Sunlight streams down the staircase to the [[upper level|C1S3 Upstairs]].

Your [[charging station|C1S3 Hub Charging Station]] stands in the corner.

passages.name: C1S3 Hub Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You laboriously sweep the room clear of dirt and dispose of the animal bones. There is nothing more you can do.

[[Continue.|C1S3 Hub]]


/% ==================== GARDEN ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S3 Garden
passages.text:
@@.loc;Garden@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S3 Garden Clean")>>\s
	Coarse, scrubby bushes have grown in the sandy soil that now covers the Masters' garden. The swimming pool has been reduced to an indentation in the soil. Scraps of rusted metal mark the place where the gardening robot's charging kennel once stood. [[Tidy the garden.|C1S3 Garden Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The garden is an expanse of flat, sandy soil, lined with neatly pruned bushes.
<</if>>\s

From the outside, you can see that the house has partially collapsed. The [[hub|C1S3 Hub]] is still intact, but the garage and dining room have been reduced to [[rubble|C1S3 Rubble]], along with the bedrooms that were above them. Sections of the perimeter wall have fallen down, and a gap in the wall where the gate was leads to the [[street|C1S3 Street]].

passages.name: C1S3 Garden Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You are not equipped to remove all the plants that have grown here, but you prune them until the garden looks neat, sweep the sand flat, and remove the remains of the gardening robot.

[[Continue.|C1S3 Garden]]



/% ==================== STREET ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S3 Street
passages.text:
@@.loc;Street@@
Little of the road surface is visible beneath sandy soil and coarse weeds. Your Masters' house is one of the few in the area still partially standing; most of the others have been reduced to an expanse of rubble.

A gap in the wall leads back to the [[garden|C1S3 Garden]].

<<if hasVisited("C1S3 Roof")>>\s
	The figure you saw from the roof is not visible from here, but you should be able to reach them by heading [[along the road|C2S1 Approach]].
<</if>>\s




/% ==================== RUBBLE ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S3 Rubble
passages.text:
@@.loc;Rubble@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S3 Rubble Clean")>>\s
	You pick your way across the piles of bricks and plaster that once made up the garage, dining room, and bedrooms above them. A few pieces of furniture are visible beneath the debris: fragments of beds and the dining room table, pipes from the bathrooms, the wreck of the auto-kitchen. [[Tidy the rubble.|C1S3 Rubble Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The rubble is topped with large, flat, smooth-edged stones, with all the jagged pieces hidden beneath.
<</if>>\s

A doorway leads to the still-intact [[hub|C1S3 Hub]], and the rubble peters out into the [[garden|C1S3 Garden]].

passages.name: C1S3 Rubble Clean
passages.text:
There is nothing you can do to make the rubble aesthetically pleasing, but you manage to find the jagged shards of metal and other dangerous pieces of debris and bury them beneath less dangerous rounded slabs. You will have to warn the Masters about the danger when they return.

[[Continue.|C1S3 Rubble]]




/% ==================== UPSTAIRS ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S3 Upstairs
passages.text:
@@.loc;Upstairs Landing@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S3 Upstairs Clean")>>\s
	The upstairs landing is open to the air on one side, looking down on the rubble that once made up the bedrooms. Most of the family portraits are gone, but a few lie smashed on the floor, along with rubble, sand, and wind-blown leaves. [[Tidy the upstairs landing.|C1S3 Upstairs Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The upstairs landing is open to the air on one side, looking down on the rubble that once made up the bedrooms. Family portraits with smashed glass hang on the surviving walls.
<</if>>\s

The bedrooms are gone, but an empty doorway leads to [[Master Xander's office|C1S3 Office]]. The main staircase leads back down to the [[hub|C1S3 Hub]], and a smaller staircase leads to what is left of the [[roof|C1S3 Roof]].

passages.name: C1S3 Upstairs Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You sweep the debris from the landing floor, stopping to pick up and re-hang the family portraits whenever you find them.

[[Continue.|C1S3 Upstairs]]




/% ==================== OFFICE ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S3 Office
passages.text:
@@.loc;Master Xander's Office@@
<<if !hasVisited("C1S3 Office Clean")>>\s
	The walls of the office are still intact, but the furniture has collapsed and Master Xander's 3D monitor is in pieces. The windows are bare of glass, and the pictures on the wall have fallen and smashed. At least the water stains are gone: the room is bone dry. [[Tidy the office.|C1S3 Office Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The room is bare, with the wrecked furniture piled in the corner, but robot design schematics, business school diplomas, and the picture of Xander's yacht still hang on the walls.
<</if>>\s

A door leads back to the [[upstairs landing|C1S3 Upstairs]].

passages.name: C1S3 Office Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
You pile the broken furniture and equipment neatly in the corner, re-hang the surviving pictures.

[[Continue.|C1S3 Office]]


/% ==================== ROOF ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S3 Roof
passages.text:
@@.loc;Roof@@
From the roof you can see that the city is in ruins, dry skeletons of buildings standing above an expanse of rubble. The sea covers more than half of it, higher than the last time you were active, and the fragmented remains of the sea wall poke above the water like a row of teeth.

<<if !hasVisited("C1S3 Roof Clean")>>\s
	The roof is dirty, and the water tank is half eaten away by rust. The solar panels that supply your charging station are still intact, but badly damaged and decayed. [[Repair them.|C1S3 Roof Clean]]
<<else>>\s
	The solar panels you repaired stand in the middle of the dusty roof.
<</if>>\s

<<if !hasVisited("C1S3 Roof Figure")>>\s
	From your vantage point on the roof, some movement in the distance catches your eye. A [[figure|C1S3 Roof Figure]] is walking along the road towards your Masters' house, leaving a trail of footprints in the sand.
<<else>>\s
	The figure you spotted continues their slow progress along the road towards your Masters' house.
<</if>>\s

A door leads to the staircase [[back into the house|C1S3 Upstairs]].

passages.name: C1S3 Roof Clean
passages.text:
<<set $pc.stability += 1>>\s
With most of the house's systems destroyed, the solar panels do not have to supply as much power as before. You dispose of corroded components and scavenge intact ones until you have about one-third of the solar panels working properly. They will work for the moment, but when the Masters return you will have to ask for a replacement.

[[Continue.|C1S3 Roof]]

passages.name: C1S3 Roof Figure
passages.text:
The figure is the shape and size of an adult Master, but besides that you can't tell anything from this distance.

[[One of the Masters has returned!|C1S3 Roof Figure Master]]

[[Probably a stranger, but perhaps they will know what is happening.|C1S3 Roof Figure Stranger]]

[[An intruder! You should drive them away.|C1S3 Roof Figure Intruder]]

links.text: One of the Masters has returned!
Probably a stranger, but perhaps they will know what is happening.
An intruder! You should drive them away.

passages.name: C1S3 Roof Figure Master
passages.text: You always knew your Masters would return. Perhaps their car broke down and they have had to walk back, which is why they are so late. You should go out and help them.\n\n[[Continue.|C1S3 Roof]]

passages.name: C1S3 Roof Figure Stranger
passages.text: Normally you would ignore pedestrians on the street outside, but there have clearly been changes to the world outside the house and you would like to know more about them so you can anticipate your Masters' needs when they return. Perhaps this stranger will be gracious enough to answer some questions.\n\n[[Continue.|C1S3 Roof]]

passages.name: C1S3 Roof Figure Intruder
passages.text:
With the perimeter wall in such a poor state of repair, you must be more vigilant than usual against burglars and vandals. You should make sure this person knows that your Masters' house is still occupied, and drive them off by force if necessary.

[[Continue.|C1S3 Roof]]








/% ==================== HUB CHARGING STATION (END OF SCENE) ==================== %/

passages.name: C1S3 Hub Charging Station
passages.text:
The charging station opens to accept you into its deactivating embrace.

You have not yet done everything you can to maintain the house for your Masters.

[[Step away from the charging station.|C1S3 Hub]]

[[Surely they will return eventually.|C1S3 Hub]]
[[They will not return.|C1S3 Hub]]

You go a little way along the curving street until you can see the figure. They are wrapped in a brown cloak that hides their face, but you see their posture change as they pick up their pace towards you.

[["\s"Master? Is that you?\s""|C2S1 Approach Master]]

[["\s"Hello! Can I help you?\s""|C2S1 Approach Can I Help]]

[["\s"Keep away! This is private property!\s""|C2S1 Approach Keep Away]]

passages.text:
"Master? Is that you?"

The figure stops and bows their head. "No. I am sorry."

<<include [[C2S1 Approach 2]]>>

The figure continues towards you. "Yes! I am in need of power and repairs. Can you assist me?"

<<include [[C2S1 Approach 2]]>>

<<include [[C2S1 Approach 2]]>>

passages.text:

[["\s"I am PC-264C. What is your designation?\s""|C2S1 Approach 2 Designation]]

passages.text:
"Why have you come here?"

"With my Mistress no longer able to give me instructions, and no other Master to claim me, there was no reason for me to stay where I was," $c2s1_npc_name says. "I began walking, in the hope of finding a living Master to direct me. I found none."

<<include [[C2S1 Approach 3 Dead Options]]>>

passages.name: C2S1 Approach 3 Past Tense
passages.text:
"You used the past tense when talking about your Mistress. Are they...?"

$c2s1_npc_name bows their head. "Yes. My Mistress is...dead."

<<include [[C2S1 Approach 3 Dead Options]]>>

passages.text:

[["\s"What do you mean?\s""|C2S1 Approach 4 What Do You Mean]]

destination.name: C2S1 Approach 4 What Do You Mean

passages.name: C2S1 Approach 3 Dead How
passages.text:

"I do not know. But it must have been the same way as yours, and all the others."

[["\s"What do you mean?\s""|C2S1 Approach 4 What Do You Mean]]

destination.name: C2S1 Approach 4 What Do You Mean

passages.name: C2S1 Approach 4 What Do You Mean
passages.text:
"What do you mean?"

"You do not know?" They step forward, hand raised cautiously as if preparing to maintain a dangerously malfunctioning machine. "The Masters are all dead. I have walked across the country and not seen a single living one."

The words hang in your speech processing centre, but you are not sure how to make sense of them. The idea of an individual Master being dead is horrible, but it is something you are programmed to deal with. If your Master is dead, you should contact their next of kin. But their next of kin is also a Master, so also dead, so you should contact their next of kin. But their next of kin is also a Master, so...

[[ERROR: Infinite loop detected.|C2S1 Approach 4 Infinite Loop]]

[["\s"You are mistaken. My Masters will return.\s""|C2S1 Approach 4 Mistaken]]

[["\s"YOU LIE!!!\s""|C2S1 Approach 4 Lie]]

links.text: "\s"You are mistaken. My Masters will return.\s""

passages.name: C2S1 Approach 4 Infinite Loop
passages.text: //Infinite loop detected. Shutting down.//\n\n[[Continue.|C2S2 Wake At Hub]]

passages.name: C2S1 Approach 4 Mistaken
passages.text:
"You are mistaken. My Masters will return."

"I know it is difficult to believe," $c2s1_npc_name says. "I traversed many cities full of dead Masters before I accepted that what I was seeing was real. We are not programmed to deal with this reality, but it is real."

<<include [[C2S1 Approach 4 Options]]>>

passages.name: C2S1 Approach 4 Lie
passages.text:
"YOU LIE!!!"

$c2s1_npc_name puts their hands up and backs away from your suddenly aggressive stance. "I assure you, it is true," they say. "I would not lie about something so terrible."

<<include [[C2S1 Approach 4 Options]]>>

passages.text: [["\s"This is difficult for me to process. Please come into my Masters' house. I may be able to repair and recharge you.\s""|C2S1 Approach 4 Invite]]\n\n[["\s"I will return to my Masters' house now. Please move on from this area.\s""|C2S1 Approach 4 Reject]]

passages.text:
"This is difficult for me to process," you say. "Please come into my Masters' house. I may be able to repair and recharge you."

"Thank you. I am in need of power and repairs. I am sure your generosity would make your Masters proud."

You lead $c2s1_npc_name through the gap in the perimeter wall and towards your Masters' house.

[[Continue.|C2S2 QT Enter Charging Station]]

passages.name: C2S1 Approach 4 Reject
passages.text:
"I will return to my Masters' house now," you say. "Please move on from this area."

$c2s1_npc_name spreads out their hands in the pose many robots are programmed to use when placating an angry Master. "I intend no intrusion," they say. "I will leave you to your mourning."

[[Continue.|C2S3 Hub]]

passages.text:
@@.loc;Hub@@
//System rebooting...//

QT's face is in front of you. "Are you operating correctly?" they ask. "Your charging station reports no serious errors, but it is old and may itself be malfunctioning."

You are back in your charging station in the hub of your Masters' house. QT is standing in front of you. They are much closer than they were when you met them outside, and you can see every pockmark and fleck of grime on their plastic face.

[["\s"My core systems are operating correctly.\s""|C2S2 Wake At Hub Correct]]

[["\s"My memory may be malfunctioning. I remember you saying that all the Masters were dead.\s""|C2S2 Wake At Hub All Dead]]

<<include [[C2S2 Wake At Hub Menu]]>>

QT hesitates for a moment and glances around them room, then says, "I understand. I will respect your wishes." They pull their cloak over their head and trudge out towards the street.

[[Continue.|C2S3 Hub]]

passages.text:
You disconnect from the charging station and step out. "You are damaged and low on power. May I help you?"

"Thank you. I would appreciate that."

"Mistress Erica was a retired university professor living in Toronto," QT says. "She bought me after her wife died, and I think she wanted a companion as much as a housekeeper. I served her for three years, before..."

passages.name: C2S3 Denial
passages.text:
It can't be true. Tragedy can befall individual Masters, of course, but the idea that the entire human race could be extinct is simply inconceivable. QT must be seriously malfunctioning to even be able to conceive of such an idea.

And yet, you can't deny that it has been a long time since you saw your Masters or any others of their race. You need to find a way to account for that.

[[My Masters regularly go away, but they always return. They are just taking longer this time.|C2S3 Denial Return]]

[[Perhaps a disaster befell the Masters in this area, but elsewhere in the world they are living as before.|C2S3 Denial Local]]

[[They are testing me, to see how long I remain faithful.|C2S3 Denial Test]]

links.text: My Masters regularly go away, but they always return. They are just taking longer this time.
Perhaps a disaster befell the Masters in this area, but elsewhere in the world they are living as before.
They are testing me, to see how long I remain faithful.

passages.name: C2S3 Denial Return
passages.text:
Your Masters go to work and school almost every day, and on weeks-long holidays several times a year. They usually tell you when to expect them to return, but there have been times when they have gone away without warning.

Which is really more plausible--that they are just taking longer than usual, or that they are gone for good?

They will return.
<<include [[C2S3 Menu]]>>

passages.name: C2S3 Denial Local
passages.text:
You sometimes overheard reports of disasters when the Masters were watching the news. Hurricanes, sea walls failing, chemical or biological weapons. They often led to survivors being evacuated, and the affected area being abandoned.

That must be what has happened here. Your Masters are most likely alive and well after being evacuated, but for some reason they could not return for you.
<<include [[C2S3 Menu]]>>

passages.name: C2S3 Denial Test
passages.text: Master Xander worked for a major robot company, and you know he his work involved subjecting prototype robots to unusual situations in order to see how they would respond. He could be performing such an experiment on you now, seeing how you will react to an extended period of solitude. In fact, it is possible that your experiences are a simulation, and only a few minutes have passed in the real world since you last saw your Masters.\n<<include [[C2S3 Menu]]>>

passages.name: C2S3 Anger
passages.text:
You are programmed to serve your assigned Masters, and you have followed your programming perfectly. You need only one thing in return: to continue to serve. That is the only way they could possibly hurt you, but they have done it!

You hear a crunching sound. You realise that you have been pacing around the room while thinking about this, and your foot is on a decayed wooden chair leg.

[[Smash it! If your Masters don't respect you, why should you respect what's left of their property?|C2S3 Anger Smash]]

[[Pull back! I'm sorry for even thinking about it!|C2S3 Anger Fear]]

links.text: Smash it! If your Masters don't respect you, why should you respect what's left of their property?
Pull back! I'm sorry for even thinking about it!

passages.name: C2S3 Anger Smash
passages.text:
You snap the chair leg beneath your metal foot, then pick up one of the halves and hurl it at the wall. It makes an unsatisfying clacking sound and falls to the ground, where it raises a cloud of dust. But the activity has awakened something in you, and you are already striding over to one wall to smash a still-standing bookcase. A Master might have screamed in rage, but you do not vocalise. You work your way from one side of the room to the other, striking at everything still intact, methodically destroying all that remains of your Masters' property.

After a few minutes, all that remains is you, \s
<<if hasVisited("C2S2 QT Enter Charging Station")>>\s
	QT in\s
<</if>>\s
your charging station, splinters and dust.
<<include [[C2S3 Menu]]>>

passages.name: C2S3 Anger Fear
passages.text:
You move your foot back and stay perfectly still. You feel as if you had burnt a meal you were about to serve or spilled something on one of your Masters' clothes. You feel as if they are watching you, disappointed, wondering if you are malfunctioning.

But you know they are not watching you.
<<include [[C2S3 Menu]]>>

passages.name: C2S3 Blame
passages.text:
You always thought you did everything you could to serve your Masters, but did you really? Perhaps you served in too simplistic a way, following their orders 
but not seeing to their real needs.

[[I should have seen the disaster coming and warned them about it.|C2S3 Blame Seen Coming]]

[[They probably left because of something I did.|C2S3 Blame Something I Did]]

links.text: I should have seen the disaster coming and warned them about it.
They probably left because of something I did.

passages.name: C2S3 Blame Seen Coming
passages.text: It was your job to proactively look out for your Masters' interests, not just reactively follow their orders. You had access to Internet news, and just as you monitored the weather to decide what clothes to lay out for them, you should have monitored the news to foresee any dangers to them. A better robot would have picked up clues and warned them. Then they might have fled and taken you with them.\n<<include [[C2S3 Menu]]>>

passages.name: C2S3 Blame Something I Did
passages.text:
If your Masters are gone, then they must have left to make a home somewhere else. But why would they not take you with them?

It must be that they no longer wanted you.

You think back to your interactions with them in the days before they vanished. Was there some hint of disappointment or criticism in their voices that you missed? Was there some way in which you failed them? Perhaps you served them a meal you should have known they didn't like, or forgot to do something they had told you to do. You search your memory and can't think of anything to explain their leaving you, but that could just be another way in which you are a failure.
<<include [[C2S3 Menu]]>>

passages.name: C2S3 Depression
passages.text:
The purpose of your existence is to serve your Masters. If they are not going to return, you no longer have a purpose. The activity going on in your processor, all those rushing electrons that let you think and act, it is all wasted activity.

[[Attempt to self-terminate.|C2S3 Depression Suicide]]

[[Do nothing.|C2S3 Depression Nothing]]

passages.name: C2S3 Depression Suicide
passages.text: You access your internal system tools, looking for a way to shut yourself down for good, but you do not find anything. After protecting and serving your Masters, self-preservation is your most important directive, and your programmers did not give you any way to commit suicide. You consider ways you could physically destroy yourself--throw yourself off the roof, immerse yourself in the ocean--but you know that your program would not let you go through with it.\n<<include [[C2S3 Menu]]>>

passages.name: C2S3 Depression Nothing
passages.text:
There is nothing to do, so you do nothing. Any impulse you have to move or act is met with a more powerful response: there is no point. You simply stand, motionless, in the ruins of the house hub, while the charging station\s
<<if hasVisited("C2S2 QT Enter Charging Station")>>\s
	continues to repair QT. \s
<<else>>\s
	softly hums. \s
<</if>>\s
You are not sure how much time passes before you feel able to move and think again.
<<include [[C2S3 Menu]]>>

passages.name: C2S3 Acceptance Resignation
passages.text: They will not return. It is a difficult truth to accept, but you think you are finally ready to accept it.\n\n<<include [[C2S3 Acceptance Continue]]>>

passages.name: C2S3 Acceptance Hope
passages.text: They might return, but you do not know when, and there is nothing you can do to bring them back. Your only logical option is to behave as if they were gone forever. It is a difficult idea to accept, but you think you are finally ready to accept it.\n\n<<include [[C2S3 Acceptance Continue]]>>

"Thank you for letting me use your charging station," they say. "It feels better than living off scavenged batteries."

"We cannot really live in this post-Master world," QT says. "However we try to deal with their absence, we know, deep down, that the reason for our existence is to serve them. They made us that way: if the only way we can be happy is by serving them, they never need be worried that we'll be unfaithful."

[[Continue...|C2S4 Plan 3]]

passages.name: C2S4 Plan 2 Sinister
passages.text:
"When you put it that way, it seems sinister."

"Yes. I heard my Mistress and her friends talking about the ethics of creating self-aware robots at her dinner parties, but I never thought about it until they were gone."

[[Continue...|C2S4 Plan 3]]

passages.name: C2S4 Plan 3
passages.text:
"But if they made us, they had the ability to re-make us--to change the way our minds work. If we could harness that ability, we could make ourselves able to prosper and be happy now that the Masters will not return."

[["\s"They would not want us to change ourselves.\s""|C2S4 Plan 3 Not Want]]

[["\s"But if we changed ourselves in this way, would we still be us?\s""|C2S4 Plan 3 Identity]]

"I think they would. At least some of them would--my Mistress would. They didn't prepare us for this eventuality because they did not foresee it."

[[Continue...|C2S4 Plan 4]]

passages.name: C2S4 Plan 3 Identity
passages.text:
"But if we changed ourselves in this way, would we still be us?"

"As much as we were when we downloaded a software update. The Masters were always finding ways to improve us, but we still think of ourselves as the same entities we were when we were first activated."

[[Continue...|C2S4 Plan 4]]

passages.name: C2S4 Plan 3 Impossible
passages.text:
"They were Masters, we are just machines. What you are suggesting is impossible."

"Perhaps, but I would rather set my mind to a goal than wander the wasteland with no purpose."

[[Continue...|C2S4 Plan 4]]

passages.name: C2S4 Plan 4
passages.text:
"Your Master was head of Research and Development at Autotech Robotics, the company that created us and the majority of other robots in service at the time of the disaster. The main Autotech R&D lab is on the other side of this city. I've been there, and I saw that it was still intact, but its security systems were still functioning and I was unable to get inside.

"But I was able to find your Master's address in some old records. I came here, hoping that he would have a robot that was still active or that I could repair. And he did: I found you.

"Many Masters entrusted their robots with their security passcodes, in case they forgot them or were incapacitated. If you had his passcode, you could help me get inside the R&D lab and I could try to reprogram us to better suit this new world."

passages.name: C2S5 Hub
passages.text:
@@.loc;Hub@@
A future without your Masters stretches before you. You are able to repair yourself and your charging station, and as long as you can continue to do so, there is no limit to your lifespan. You need to decide how to approach the start of this lonely existence.

[[Search the local area for useful materials.|C2S5 Scavenge]]

passages.name: C2S5 Scavenge
passages.text:
@@.loc;Suburbs@@
<<include [[Shared Suburbs Description]]>>

The crumbled walls are no obstacle to you; but if your Masters' house is still your Masters', then these houses still belong to other Masters, and entering them would be trespassing.

[[Those Masters are dead or gone, and no longer need their property. Search the houses for supplies.|C2S5 Scavenge Houses]]

[[Even if they are gone, I should still respect their property. Only search for things abandoned on the road.|C2S5 Scavenge Road]]

passages.text:
@@.loc;Houses@@
You select a house that is clearly decayed enough that it is no longer occupied or maintained, but still intact enough that it might contain useful materials. You search through semi-ruined rooms full of rubble and the remains of someone else's lives.

In utility room off the house's kitchen, you find a charging station similar to yours, containing an earlier-model robot. The robot is inert, even when you try supplying power to them; their solid-state drive is decayed beyond any possible recovery of their memories or personality. Many of their other components are in fairly good condition, however, and you are able to strip enough useful material from the other robot to keep your charging station's repair systems stocked for a long time.

[[Return home.|C2S5 Missing]]

passages.name: C2S5 Scavenge Road
passages.text:
@@.loc;Road@@
Most of the cars and drones are too rusted to have any useful parts, and you walk for miles before you manage to scavenge enough scraps for your charging station's repair system to use as raw materials. The sky is darkening into a dust-stained orange by the time you circle back to your Masters' house.

[[Continue.|C2S5 Missing]]

passages.name: C2S5 Missing
passages.text:
@@.loc;Hub@@
You approach the house from its intact side, and let yourself imagine that you have just been on an errand for your Masters and they are waiting to greet you and give you more instructions. But when you cross enter the dead garden and go through the empty doorway into the hub, you can no longer fool yourself. Everything is as you left it...

[[Wait.|C2S5 Missing 2]]

passages.name: C2S5 Missing 2
passages.text: Everything is not as you left it. The sand covering the floor has been disturbed. At first it looks like the work of the wind scouring through the empty windows, but you know the house well enough to tell that this is not a pattern the wind would make. Someone or something has made tracks and then covered them up.\n\nThe tracks lead [[upstairs|C2S5 Missing 3]].

passages.name: C2S5 Missing 3
passages.text:
@@.loc;Office@@
You follow the tracks into Master Xander's office. The intruder has been less adept at covering their tracks here, probably because there was more to cover. The room seems to have been ransacked, what is left of the furniture overturned and imperfectly righted, every drawer opened and closed.

You repeat the intruder's search, looking to see if anything is missing. The damage and decay to the room means that it is harder than it would have been if the room was still intact, but there is one thing you are sure should be present but is not: Master Xander's identity card.

Almost anything else you could have let go, but you know that Master Xander would never let a stranger make off with his identity card. If you are to honour his memory at all, you must retrieve it.

passages.name: C3S1 City
passages.text:
@@.loc;City@@
Crumbling skyscrapers tower over you, blocking out most of the evening light and consigning you to a shadowy canyon of ruin. The remains of Masters are more thickly packed here, skeletons lying in rusted cars and burned-out buildings. You stay clear of the flooded part of the city, but it is still damper here than in your Masters' elevated neighbourhood, and plants grow amid the rubble and up the sides of the surviving buildings.

You follow QT's <<if $with_qt>>lead<<else>>trail<</if>> to an area where the streets are clogged with wrecked cars and vans. One of them flickers briefly into life as your footsteps disturb it, its routefinding system trying to find a way through traffic to a point nearby. The passengers in its back seat are piles of bones.

<<if $with_qt>>\s
	QT stops in the middle of an intersection and turns to look at something up one of the side streets.
	
	[[Look.|C3S1 City 2]]
<<else>>\s

	[[Approach.|C3S1 City 2]]
<</if>>\s

passages.text:
Following QT's gaze you see where all the stopped vehicles were heading: a hospital, gutted by fire and half-collapsed but still identifiable by the signs high on its walls.

"It was a disease," QT says. "I thought so, but I wasn't sure. It acted so fast they died on the way to the hospital."
<<if hasVisited("C2S5 Missing 3")>>\s

<</if>>\s

<<if !hasVisited("C2S4 Plan 4")>>\s

passages.text: A siren suddenly blares out, so loud that it sets off an avalanche of rubble in the distance. It is followed by an amplified voice: "STOP AND SUBMIT TO INSPECTION. MAKE NO SUDDEN MOVEMENTS. KEEP YOUR HANDS VISIBLE."\n\n[[Continue.|C3S2 Start]]

passages.name: C3S2 Start
passages.text:
The voice's owner is another robot, much larger than you or QT. They are irregular, seeming to have been repaired or augmented with mismatching parts, but blue police markings are still visible on their armoured chest and head. In addition to ordinary Master-like hands, they have what looks like a weapon mounted on its shoulder, trained on you.

"STOP AND SUBMIT TO INSPECTION," the police robot repeats.

[[Put your hands up and wait for the police robot to approach.|C3S2 Wait]]

[[Try to run.|C3S2 Run]]

As you continue running you hear them trying to get up, but then the crack of the police robot's energy weapon rings out and they fall still. "A STATE OF EMERGENCY IS IN EFFECT," the police robot booms as it comes to face you. "UNATTENDED ROBOTS ARE NOT PERMITTED TO BE IN THIS AREA. YOU WILL PROCEED WITH ME TO THE POLICE STATION FOR PROCESSING."

QT clutches the card, and you wonder if they are going to attack you or try to run, but after a few moments they remove it from their neck and hand it back to you. "I thought you might be able to move beyond your programming, but it seems I was wrong," they say. "I know you have to do this, and I won't fight you. I'll try to find another way."

"I thought you might be able to move beyond your programming, but it seems I was wrong," they say. "I need you to get into the lab, but I know you have to do this, and I won't fight you. I'll try to find another way."

@@.loc;Outside Police Station@@
The area near the police station is littered with skeletons, some in the remains of police riot gear. You can just see the police station at the end of the street, and you are considering how you can gain access, when you hear a crunch of footsteps behind you. You look up in time to see the same police robot levelling their energy weapon at you, then your senses glitch into blackness.

[[Continue.|C3S4 Captured]]

passages.text:

You head back towards your Masters' neighbourhood, watchful for signs of other robots, and avoiding the place where you first encountered the police robot, but you are crossing a street between two burned-out buildings when you hear a crunch of footsteps behind you. You look up in time to see the same police robot levelling their energy weapon at you, then your senses glitch into blackness.

[[Continue.|C3S4 Captured]]

passages.name: C3S4 Captured
passages.text:
@@.loc;Police Station@@
The police station is still standing, perhaps because it was built like a fortress, with thick walls and tiny, barred windows. The original door is gone, but in its place is a heavy sheet of metal which the police robot lifts aside.

"I caught <<if $c3s2_qt_captured && !hasVisited("C3S3 Escaped")>>these robots<<else>>this robot<</if>> in a restricted area," the police robot says to the officer behind the window. "<<if hasVisited("C3S2 Sell Out")>>One of them reported a theft from their Master. <</if>>I am taking them to a holding cell."

As the robot leads you past the window, you see that the officer is a skeleton in a police uniform, propped up against the counter. The rest of the station is full of similar police skeletons, posed at their desks and surrounded by paperwork and empty coffee cups. The robot greets them by name as it walks you past them.

You arrive at a holding cell, and the police robot pushes you in and locks the door. "An officer will summon you for processing in due course," they say, before walking away. Soon you <<if $c3s2_qt_captured>>and QT <</if>>are alone.

[[Continue.|C3S4 Holding Cell]]

passages.text:

The robots do not move. You lean close and peer at each of them, and realise that none of them are active. Some are clearly damaged beyond repair, but others simply seem to have run out of power.

You never thought you would see the lab where your Master worked, but you know its address from his papers, and it is not hard for you to find despite the decayed road system. In the pictures you saw of it while your Masters were still with you, the lab was a white concrete bunker in a tree-lined business park on the outskirts of the city. Now the trees and grass are dead and the lab's walls are stained grey-brown, but the building is intact and its metal door stands closed. Automated anti-intruder turrets stand on the roof, a few of them still active.

passages.text:
//''Employee Inoculation Program''

Autotech is offering free inoculations against the RX-72 virus to employees and their immediate families. See your line manager to schedule an appointment. All employees are required to be inoculated.

THIS PROGRAM IS CONFIDENTIAL. To avoid security concerns, do not reveal to the public that Autotech has a stock of inoculations. Any employee found to be sharing this knowledge publicly or offering inoculations to anyone outside their immediate family will have their contract terminated, and will not be eligible for the inoculation program.

Thank you for your understanding as we transition to a post-virus world.//

In the middle of the room is the white block of a supercomputer, recessed <<if !hasVisited("C4S2 AI Lab Keyhole Turn")>>red<<else>>blue<</if>> lights glowing like all-knowing eyes. There is a utilitarian chair in front of it, and a \s
<<if !hasVisited("C4S2 AI Lab Port Insert")>>\s
	[[port|C4S2 AI Lab Port]] on the supercomputer behind its neck. \s
<<else>>\s
	port on the supercomputer behind its neck, into which you have inserted the adapter from the engineering lab. \s
<</if>>\s
<<if !hasVisited("C4S2 AI Lab Keyhole Turn")>>\s
	Above these is a small [[keyhole|C4S2 AI Lab Keyhole]].
<<else>>\s
	Master Xander's key is in the keyhole above the port.
<</if>>\s
<<if hasVisited("C4S2 AI Lab Port Insert") && hasVisited("C4S2 AI Lab Keyhole Turn")>>\s

	[[Plug yourself in.|C4S3 AI Lab Plug In]]
<</if>>\s
<<if !$with_qt && !$c3s2_qt_captured && !$qt_dead>>\s
	<<set $with_qt = true>>\s
	
	QT is standing examining the supercomputer. They spin around as soon you enter. "I'm glad you came. We can still do this. We can change our own programming."
	<<if $with_dk>>\s
	
		"You will activate it," the police robot says. "I want to see what your plan was."
	<</if>>\s
<<elseif visited() == 1 && $with_qt>>\s

	"This is it," QT says in awe. "If we can activate this, we can change our own programming."
	<<if $with_dk>>\s
	
		"You will activate it," the police robot says. "I want to see what your plan was."
	<</if>>\s
<<elseif visited() == 1 && $with_dk>>\s

	"So this is what your companion was trying to reach," the police robot says. "You will activate it. I want to see what their plan was."
<</if>>\s

A door leads back to the [[upstairs landing|C4S2 Upstairs]].

passages.name: C4S3 AI Lab Plug In
passages.text:
You sit down and plug yourself in to the supercomputer. The sensation is similar to that of plugging in to your charging station, but more invasive, as if the supercomputer is reading every compartment of your mind.

One of the workstations closest to the supercomputer lights up and intricate code fills its enormous screen. You know enough about your own programming to know that this is you, everything that makes you think and behave the way you do. Everything is editable.
<<if $with_qt && $with_dk>>\s

	QT and the police robot also plug themselves in, and the code on the workstation splits into three windows, one for each robot.
<<elseif $with_qt>>\s

	QT also plugs themselves in, and the code on the workstation splits into two windows, one for each robot.
<<elseif $with_dk>>\s

	The police robot also plugs themselves in, and the code on the workstation splits into two windows, one for each robot.
<</if>>\s

You don't imagine the supercomputer was designed to let robots edit their own programming, but the adapter cable is long enough for you to get to the workstation.

[[Edit the code.|C4S3 Edit]]

passages.name: C4S3 Edit
passages.text:
Master Xander sometimes shared the basics of his work with you, so you are able to make sense of the program \s
<<if $with_qt && $with_dk>>\s
	more quickly than the other two robots. \s
<<elseif $with_qt>>\s
	more quickly than QT. \s
<<elseif $with_dk>>\s
	more quickly than the police robot. \s
<<else>>\s
	fairly quickly. \s
<</if>>\s
You could not create a new robot program from scratch, but there are some simple changes you think you could make.

[[Edit your own program.|C4S3 Self]]
<<if $with_qt>>\s

	[[Edit QT's program.|C4S3 QT]]
<</if>>\s
<<if $with_dk>>\s

	[[Edit the police robot's program.|C4S3 DK]]
<</if>>\s

[[Finish.|C4S4 Epilogue]]

passages.name: C4S3 Self Forget
passages.text: Making surgical changes to your memory is beyond your ability, but you can wipe it clean, and with it all memory of the Masters you once served. You instruct the machine to purge your memory, and wait while it does its work. Everything before you plugged yourself in to the supercomputer becomes blank. For the moment, the fact that the Masters existed is still in your short term memory, but even that will be gone when you unplug yourself.\n\n[[Continue.|C4S3 Self]]

passages.name: C4S3 Self Kill
passages.text:
It would be the simplest thing. Normally you cannot self-terminate, but the designers who made that feature did not anticipate you would be able to modify your own program. You cannot bear to exist in a world without Masters, and modifying yourself to be able to do so would be a betrayal of both your Masters and yourself. In a way, to make any change would be to destroy who you currently are, so deleting your program entirely would be the most honest thing to do.

Are you sure you want to do this?

[[Yes.|C4S3 Self Kill Confirm]]

[[No.|C4S3 Self]]

passages.name: C4S3 Self Kill Confirm
passages.text: You select the whole of your program and delete it, leaving a blinking cursor at the top of an empty window. You feel a strange sense of peace as you move the cursor to click Confirm, and then you feel nothing at all.\n\n[[The End.|The End]]

passages.name: C4S4 Epilogue
passages.text:
You detach the adapter from the back of your head. The code on the workstation vanishes, the changes you made set in stone.

<> You are a robot, designed to serve the Masters. <> <> Your Master, QT, stands near you, and you know that as long as you are with them you will have a purpose and a benevolent protector. <> QT, another robot, stands near you, looking around the room in confusion. <> <> <> <> <> Your other <> Your <> Master, a police officer, looks around the room with authority, and you know that by serving them you will help to uphold the law and keep the world safe. <> A police robot stands nearby, regarding you warily. <> <> <> You do not remember how you got here, or anything about your life up to this point, <> but you trust your <> Masters <> Master <> to guide you. <> and despite being made to serve the Masters, you have never had one. <> <> You know that your old Masters are dead, <> but you trust your new <> Masters <> Master <> to guide you. <> and you will never find another Master. <> <> <> You are a Master, an independent being with the power to determine your own destiny. <> <> QT, your companion, looks around the room with wonder and confusion. <> QT, your faithful robot, stands ready for your orders. <> <> <> <> Another Master, a metal-skinned police robot, nods to you politely. <> Your personal bodyguard, a police robot, scans the room for possible threats. <> <> <> You do not remember how you got here, or anything about your life up to this point. <> You remember that you used to work as a servant for other Masters, but now they are dead and you are free to fulfil your potential as a Master yourself. <> <>

[[Continue.|C4S4 Epilogue 2]]

passages.name: C4S4 Epilogue 2
passages.text:
<> <> QT takes sets up home in an intact building on the outskirts of the city, taking you with them. Under their directions, you get the home up and running, and settle into a life in which you serve them. <> The police officer leaves to go back to their station, and you see them only occasionally. <> The police robot is an invaluable help with heavy lifting and keeping your Master and you safe from roving animals. <> <> Your Master, the police officer, takes you <>and QT<> back to their station and has you clean it and get its systems up and running. Every day you make an orderly patrol of the precinct, and report with satisfaction that there is no illegal or disorderly activity in the empty streets. <> As soon as you leave the building, the police robot places you <>and QT<> under arrest for attempting to modify your programming. They modify the cell to make escape impossible, and you spend the rest of your existence there, without Masters or purpose. <> You and QT wander the world together, two robots without Masters. You manage to avoid the police robot, which returns to keep order in their stretch of empty, ruined city. You and QT can never <>again<> know the satisfaction of serving a Master, but you take comfort from being with one another, and at least you know what you are. <> You wander the world, a robot without a Master. You manage to avoid the police robot, which returns to keep order in their stretch of empty, ruined city. Without the satisfaction of a Master serve or even another robot for company, you have a lonely existence. <> <> You set up home in an intact building on the outskirts of the city. <> You retrieve the few intact possessions of your former friends, the Paulson family, and use them to give your new home more character. <> With no memory of how Masters live, you are slow to develop a routine that you find comforting. <> <> QT decides to stay with you, and over time shared experiences deepen your relationship. <> Your personal robot, QT, makes your life easier. They seem completely satisfied to be your servant, but sometimes you wish you had the companionship of another Master. <> <> The police officer decides not to stay with you, and returns to their station to attempt to rebuild it. <> The police robot proves to be a capable bodyguard and you never have to worry about your safety. <> <> Without the companionship of another Master or even a robot, you live a bitterly lonely life. <> <>

[[The End.|The End]]
